intro: Basananthe kottoensis, commonly known as the Kottoense banana plant, is a species native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Musaceae family, which includes other banana and plantain species. The plant is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and a robust, herbaceous stem. It produces clustered, fleshy berries that are typically yellow when ripe. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it holds significance in both ecological and botanical studies.
